item.title: J Doe
item.description: That video is a grim reminder of law enforcement’s ridiculous over-response to the very rumor of an encounter with a Black person. Story time: In 1998, while I was living in San Francisco, I was pulled over while walking on the corner of 17th and Valencia by two cops, a (white) man and a (possibly Latina) woman. I was stopped, questioned, patted down, and detained (they didn’t cuff me, and I got to sit) because the male cop said I “resembled a suspect they’d been looking for” (read: Black and male with a head of hair).
